poem:
**Green Ink Letters**

In green ink, the absurd are penned,  
Martindale's tome, an unlikely friend.  
The whimsical scribes, with notions unfurled,  
Claiming truths from another world.  
Admirals, spooks, with cryptic art,  
In verdant script, reveal their heart.  
Penrith chuckles, from editor's seat,   
Madness on paper, complete and neat.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Correspondents reveal their true colours | Brief letters The correspondence on the use of green ink (Letters, 26 June) reminded me that when I was the editor of Martindale’s Extra Pharmacopoeia (a long time ago) I received a lot of letters written in green ink. Invariably they were promoting ridiculous ideas. I had no idea that they might have come from an admiral or the head of an intelligence service.Jim ReynoldsPenrith, Cumbria • Am I". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
